dialogue.string: �Welcome to the Chocobo Racing Association's (CRA)  �[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst] branch.This service desk is here to accommodate our beginning and intermediate racers.
1�Participation in our organization's races requires that you either possess  $???? or currently have your own full-grown chocobo.
1�How about you, ?[sir/ma'am]?
1�If possible, we would like you to join us, and help show those trainers in  �[Bastok and Windurst/San d'Oria and Windurst/San d'Oria and Bastok] which racing team is truly the best in Vana'diel.
1�What do you say?Tell me more.Sign me up!Not today.

1�What would you like to know?Why race chocobos, anyway?How do I register for a race?How do I prepare for a race?What are chocobucks?What kind of races are there?What are ??racing teams???Quit.Return.
1�Why not!?Our original plan was to establish locations across Vana'diel where people could test their birds' skills.
1�We felt that this would help us maintain breeder motivation, which in turn would ensure healthier, happier chocobos. A ??win-win situation,?? as we like to call it in the business.
1�However, as rumors of these new facilities began to leak out into the world, people began speculating about the possibility of officially sanctioned chocobo races...
1�The VCS could not ignore the voice of the masses, and it was not long before a meeting was held, a vote was taken, and the CRA was formed.
1�And that's why I'm here, trying to enlist you and other top breeders into our noble ranks.
1�Oh, and for our more seasoned veterans who feel there are no challenges left for them here at the track, the CRA has finished preparing a new race. And rumor has that it's a doozie!
1�First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.
1�Next, you must bring me either  $???? or  $????. This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.
1�As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.
1�Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.
1�Once you have registered your chocobo and entered it in a competition, the CRA will proceed in assigning it a licensed jockey.
1�Before each race you will be given the opportunity to give the jockey specific orders on his or her riding style.
1�In addition to these orders, you can also provide the jockey with items to use while riding, as well as equipment to improve your chocobo's performance.

1�Before a race, you can also check the strengths and weaknesses of the other participating chocobos. It is recommended that you use this data when deciding on what orders to give, or which items to equip.
1�Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint chocobucks.
1�Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.
1�Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.
1�There are two main types of races.
1�The first type is called an official race. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.
1�Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.
1�You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.

1�However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.
1�The second type of race is called a free run. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match.

1�You must pay a fee in gil to participate in free runs, but you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance. You can join as many free runs as you wish in a single day (Earth time), but extra fees may be required for each additional race. (Stable hands have to make a living, too!)
1�The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.
1�Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.
1�Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.
1�In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.
1�You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.
1�Anyway, there is no harm in visiting all three racing teams to find which one suits you best (though I know you'll choose this one).
1�Congratulations,  !You are now an official member of the CRA's  �[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst] racing team.
1�I see.Please come back if you ever change your mind!
�Welcome to the Chocobo Racing Association's (CRA)  �[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst] branch.This service desk is here to accommodate our beginning and intermediate racers.

1�My apologies, ?[sir/ma'am], but it appears that you have yet to conduct all of the necessary processing at the service area for advanced and veteran racers. Please speak to the attendants there for further assistance.
1�Ah, it says here that you are a member of the  �[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst] racing team.
1�Have you come today to change your affiliation?

1�Remember, you will not be able to use any chocobucks earned in  �[San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst] here, and you will also lose any Solo Victory Points that you may have. Are you sure you want to go through with this?
1�Join this team?Yes.No.
1�Congratulations! You are the newest member of the CRA's  [San d'Oria/Bastok/Windurst] racing team!
1�Understood. But remember, we are always looking for great racers like you to join our team. If you ever change your mind, I'll be right here waiting.
1�Ah, so you have brought items for your chocobo.
1�What do we have here...
1�Alright,  , I will store this in our safe.
1�Alright,  , I will store these in our safe.
1�I am sorry, but you have already brought me one of those.
1�I am sorry, but you have already brought me these items.
1�I am sorry, but you have already brought me one of those.
1�So you wish to register a chocobo.
1�Let me see...????? has already been registered.
1�Do you wish to cancel ?????'s registration and sign up ??????
1�Let me see...????? has already been registered.
1�I'm sorry. You have already registered that chocobo. You may race it at any time.
1�Register ??????Yes.No.
1�Excellent! ????? has been successfully registered.
1�Very well.
1�Ah,  .We have been holding on to the prize from your last race until you had room enough in your gobbiebag to carry it back to your Mog House.
1�Hello there,  .Why yes, we are holding your #????. Here you are.
1�Might you be  ?Excellent. VCS headquarters was informed that you would be stopping by our branch, and sent this package containing the prize from your last race.
1�Good day to you,  .Indeed, we are currently holding your #???? from the CRA for safekeeping.Here you are.
1� , thank you for waiting.

1�Much to the VCS and the CRA's delight, the recent efforts of chocobo breeders across Vana'diel has helped to generate an unprecedented amount of interest in our endeavor.More people than ever have begun to express an interest in raising their own chocobo.

1�As a means of expressing our gratitude, we have therefore decided to confer upon the victors of CRA Classics rewards befitting a champion.We congratulate you on your impressive achievement,  . You are a true inspiration for breeders everywhere!

1�Which would you like to hear about?CRA rationale behind veteran races.How do I register for a race?How do I prepare for a race?What are chocobucks?What kinds of races are there?What are ??racing teams???What about race opponents?Quit.Return.
1�With the establishment of the Chocobo Circuit and the introduction of chocobo races, the hidden talents of a number of chocobos across Vana'diel finally had a venue in which to come to fruition.
1�As the next step, the CRA recognized these rare and valuable talents, and developed a new, special kind of race to showcase them even more than before!
1�??The Monster Races??!
1�Without the interference of jockeys, breeders can now pit their chocobos head-to-head against a number of monster species in brutal, raw, no-holds-barred racing!

1�Even some of the CRA's very own best and brightest chocobos will be entering into these races geared specifically to our veteran clientele.What more thrilling way to spend a day at the races than to see Vana'diel's most elite chocobos competing against its most fiendish monsters!?
1�First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.
1�Next, you must bring me either  $???? or  $????. This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.
1�As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.
1�Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.

1�Since these races are geared towards our more veteran racers and will not make use of jockeys, all in-race conduct is based solely on the chocobos themselves. The CRA wants these races to be as pure as possible!

1�The same philosophy applies to the usage of items as well. Simply preset the items you wish for your chocobo to have at its disposal.It will use them as it sees fit based on real-time assessment of racing conditions.

1�Many breeders are distressed by these rules, but we assure you there is no need for concern.If your chocobo has progressed far enough in the Chocobo Circuit to even be participating in the Monster Races, it is a given that it has enough know-how to use its items wisely. Have faith in your bird.

1�Also, as with other races in the past, you will be able to check on the strengths and weaknesses of your opponents at this service area.Many breeders like to use this information for developing their race strategies, and we encourage you to do the same.
1�Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint chocobucks.
1�Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.
1�Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.
1�There are two main types of races.
1�The first type is called an official race. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.
1�Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.
1�You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.

1�However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.

1�The second type of race is called a free run. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match. In addition, you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance.
1�You are not able to sign up for free runs at this location. To do so, please visit the appropriate service area for beginning and intermediate racers.Thank you for your understanding.
1�The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.
1�Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.
1�Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.
1�In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.
1�You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.
1�Anyway, there is no harm in visiting all three racing teams to find which one suits you best (though I know you'll choose this one).
1�Your opponents in the official monster races will be any of a host of beasts reared and trained by racing aficionado and announcer extraordinaire, Markovich.

1�We ensure all participating breeders that these monsters are in no way enhanced or engineered for racing excellence.The CRA has been adamant about maintaining race participants to as close to their natural state of being as possible.
1�Though each variety of monster does in fact possess characteristic abilities and traits.And they have undergone extensive training to optimize their use of these in races.

1�As with the chocobos, however, the monsters will be absent jockeys of any kind.It is possible, and expected, that they will often unleash their wild, animalistic instincts on the racetrack.Consider yourself warned.

1�In the spirit of drawing crowds, the CRA has also elected to place some of their finest birds on the racing roster as well.Breeders can also expect to see other superior-class chocobos taking part.It's going to take a lot more than just speed and endurance to win these races!

1�Finally, in the absence of jockeys, finish-line sensors will be employed.These devices will be attached to the contestants' ankles, or in the absence of ankles, some other such appropriate place.
1�With newly developed CRA technology, you can now relive the excitement of a previously cleared official race!
1�You may participate in these ??re-runs?? as many times as you wish, but just remember--the race may be the same, but the prizes for placing won't!
1�Which race would you like to rerun?Dueler's Race.Survival Race.Deadly Race.Mystery Race.Lethal Race.Dream Race.------------Quit.Return.

1�Even some of the CRA's very own best and brightest chocobos will be entering into these races geared specifically to our veteran clientele.What more thrilling way to spend a day at the races than to see Vana'diel's most elite chocobos competing against its most fiendish monsters!?

1�Without the interference of jockeys, breeders can now pit their chocobos head-to-head against a number of monster species in brutal, raw, no-holds-barred racing!

1�Even some of the CRA's very own best and brightest chocobos will be entering into these races geared specifically to our veteran clientele.What more thrilling way to spend a day at the races than to see Vana'diel's most elite chocobos competing against its most fiendish monsters!?
1�First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.
1�Next, you must bring me either  $???? or  $????. This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.
1�As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.
1�Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.

1�Since these races are geared towards our more veteran racers and will not make use of jockeys, all in-race conduct is based solely on the chocobos themselves. The CRA wants these races to be as pure as possible!

1�The same philosophy applies to the usage of items as well. Simply preset the items you wish for your chocobo to have at its disposal.It will use them as it sees fit based on real-time assessment of racing conditions.

1�Many breeders are distressed by these rules, but we assure you there is no need for concern.If your chocobo has progressed far enough in the Chocobo Circuit to even be participating in the Monster Races, it is a given that it has enough know-how to use its items wisely. Have faith in your bird.

1�Also, as with other races in the past, you will be able to check on the strengths and weaknesses of your opponents at this service area.Many breeders like to use this information for developing their race strategies, and we encourage you to do the same.
1�Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint chocobucks.
1�Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.
1�Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.
1�There are two main types of races.
1�The first type is called an official race. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.
1�Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.
1�You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.

1�However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.

1�The second type of race is called a free run. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match. In addition, you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance.
1�You are not able to sign up for free runs at this location. To do so, please visit the appropriate service area for beginning and intermediate racers.Thank you for your understanding.
1�The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.
1�Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.
1�Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.
1�In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.
1�You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.
1�Anyway, there is no harm in visiting all three racing teams to find which one suits you best (though I know you'll choose this one).
1�Your opponents in the official monster races will be any of a host of beasts reared and trained by racing aficionado and announcer extraordinaire, Markovich.

1�We ensure all participating breeders that these monsters are in no way enhanced or engineered for racing excellence.The CRA has been adamant about maintaining race participants to as close to their natural state of being as possible.
1�Though each variety of monster does in fact possess characteristic abilities and traits.And they have undergone extensive training to optimize their use of these in races.

1�As with the chocobos, however, the monsters will be absent jockeys of any kind.It is possible, and expected, that they will often unleash their wild, animalistic instincts on the racetrack.Consider yourself warned.

1�In the spirit of drawing crowds, the CRA has also elected to place some of their finest birds on the racing roster as well.Breeders can also expect to see other superior-class chocobos taking part.It's going to take a lot more than just speed and endurance to win these races!

1�Finally, in the absence of jockeys, finish-line sensors will be employed.These devices will be attached to the contestants' ankles, or in the absence of ankles, some other such appropriate place.

1�Which would you like to hear about?CRA rationale behind veteran races.How do I register for a race?How do I prepare for a race?What are chocobucks?What kinds of races are there?What are ??racing teams???What about race opponents?Quit.Return.
1�With the establishment of the Chocobo Circuit and the introduction of chocobo races, the hidden talents of a number of chocobos across Vana'diel finally had a venue in which to come to fruition.
1�As the next step, the CRA recognized these rare and valuable talents, and developed a new, special kind of race to showcase them even more than before!
1�??The Monster Races??!
1�Without the interference of jockeys, breeders can now pit their chocobos head-to-head against a number of monster species in brutal, raw, no-holds-barred racing!

1�Even some of the CRA's very own best and brightest chocobos will be entering into these races geared specifically to our veteran clientele.What more thrilling way to spend a day at the races than to see Vana'diel's most elite chocobos competing against its most fiendish monsters!?
1�First of all, your chocobo must be fully grown. It doesn't matter if you are still tending to it, or if it has been sent to pasture, as long as it is large enough to ride.
1�Next, you must bring me either  $???? or  $????. This is all I will require. There are no hidden fees.
1�As your chocobo develops, be sure to re-register it. This will ensure that your steed is provided with the equipment that most suits its current condition.
1�Finally, you may only register one chocobo at a time, but are free to register a new bird whenever you wish. You need only speak with me to make any necessary changes.

1�Since these races are geared towards our more veteran racers and will not make use of jockeys, all in-race conduct is based solely on the chocobos themselves. The CRA wants these races to be as pure as possible!

1�The same philosophy applies to the usage of items as well. Simply preset the items you wish for your chocobo to have at its disposal.It will use them as it sees fit based on real-time assessment of racing conditions.

1�Many breeders are distressed by these rules, but we assure you there is no need for concern.If your chocobo has progressed far enough in the Chocobo Circuit to even be participating in the Monster Races, it is a given that it has enough know-how to use its items wisely. Have faith in your bird.

1�Also, as with other races in the past, you will be able to check on the strengths and weaknesses of your opponents at this service area.Many breeders like to use this information for developing their race strategies, and we encourage you to do the same.
1�Depending on your chocobo's performance in select CRA-sanctioned races, you may or may not receive a prize consisting of VCS-mint chocobucks.
1�Chocobucks can be used to purchase items, as well as upgrade your mount. Chocobucks are also required to participate in official races.
1�Currently, players can earn up to, but no more than, 1000 chocobucks. However, this may change without notice.
1�There are two main types of races.
1�The first type is called an official race. To participate in one of these, you will require chocobucks.
1�Placing in an official race will earn you gil. The more races you complete, the more respected you will become in the breeder community.
1�You may also take part in an official race as often as needed to complete the specified objectives.

1�However, after some of the more grueling races, you may be required to wait before entering the next. This is to give your chocobo, as well as the others, an opportunity to rest before running again.

1�The second type of race is called a free run. Unlike the official races, these can be run at any time, regardless of the results of a previous match. In addition, you will have the opportunity to earn chocobucks depending on your chocobo's performance.
1�You are not able to sign up for free runs at this location. To do so, please visit the appropriate service area for beginning and intermediate racers.Thank you for your understanding.
1�The CRA is split up into three racing teams representing Bastok, Windurst, and San d'Oria.
1�Each team has its own skilled jockeys, and offers unique services that cannot be obtained at the other two.
1�Breeders are allowed to register with any team they like, and may change their affiliation at any time.
1�In the event that you wish to leave a racing team, all official race results, as well as earned chocobucks, will be saved.
1�You never have to worry that your past accomplishments may be deleted and lost forever. You only need rejoin the team to restore all your old data.
1�Anyway, there is no harm in visiting all three racing teams to find which one suits you best (though I know you'll choose this one).
1�Your opponents in the official monster races will be any of a host of beasts reared and trained by racing aficionado and announcer extraordinaire, Markovich.

1�We ensure all participating breeders that these monsters are in no way enhanced or engineered for racing excellence.The CRA has been adamant about maintaining race participants to as close to their natural state of being as possible.
1�Though each variety of monster does in fact possess characteristic abilities and traits.And they have undergone extensive training to optimize their use of these in races.

1�As with the chocobos, however, the monsters will be absent jockeys of any kind.It is possible, and expected, that they will often unleash their wild, animalistic instincts on the racetrack.Consider yourself warned.

1�In the spirit of drawing crowds, the CRA has also elected to place some of their finest birds on the racing roster as well.Breeders can also expect to see other superior-class chocobos taking part.It's going to take a lot more than just speed and endurance to win these races!

1�Finally, in the absence of jockeys, finish-line sensors will be employed.These devices will be attached to the contestants' ankles, or in the absence of ankles, some other such appropriate place.

1�What would you like to know about?The promenade.Chocobet centers.The grandstand.Portals.Guides.Nothing for now.
1�Shops, as well as attendants to assist you in siging up your chocobo for a race, are located on the promenade.
1�It can be found just south of here.
1�The promenade itself is split into eastern and western halves, both of which house all of the same facilities. Be sure to stop by and have a look when you get a chance.
1�Attendants at the chocobet centers are there to assist you with acquiring  $????, as well as collecting your winnings.

1�There are a total of five centers readily available for your convenience, each of which are located near the transportation portals. There are two to the east and west of here, and one just to the north.
1�All chocobet centers are capable of providing the same services.
1�The grandstand faces the racetrack itself, and allows spectators to sit and enjoy the races in comfort.
1�To get there, just follow the red carpet all the way through the betting area. You can't miss it.

1�The standard admission fee is 
� gil. Patrons who possess 6???? may enter free of charge.
1�?5???? will be provided anytime you purchase  $???? or sign up for a race.
1�Your 3???? will become invalid as soon as you leave the grandstand. Reentry will require you to pay an additional admission fee.
1�This racetrack is equipped with portals to transport our patrons to any of the three nations, as well as Jeuno and Al Zahbi.

1�As you can see, we are regularly visited by a multitude of race fans, breeders, and jockeys from every realm imaginable. We have therefore relegated each portal to a single destination in an attempt to avoid congestion.
1�For the same reasons, we ask that visitors refrain from setting up bazaars while here. Violators of this rule will be severely punished.Your cooperation is appreciated.
1�Guides can be found throughout the premises waiting to assist you.
1�They can help by transporting you to the location of your choice.
1�This service is provided free of charge, so please don't hesitate to make use of it.
1�What would you like to know about?Racing teams.Race rules.Race types.Victory points.Race Progression.That's about it.
1�A race chocobo's owner or jockey may join one of the three racing teams by registering at the appropriate VCS branch.
1�Each nation's Team Victory Points are the sum total of all of its members' Solo Victory Points. The Team Victory Point totals are then used to determine the overall weekly standings.
1�In order to race your chocobo here, we ask that you please affiliate yourself first with one of the three teams.
1�For details, please check with your local CRA racing center.
1�The races held here are almost identical to the official and private races held at the other racetracks.
1�What distinguishes our races is the fact that victories here qualify you to collect larger cash purses, as well as Victory Points.
1�Eligibility to participate in the higher-level races will require a certain number of Solo Victory Points.
1�Depending on a team's weekly standings, its members may suffer certain eligibility restrictions. At the same time, they may also be privy to certain benefits.
1�The teams in second and third place will have the advantage of being allowed more entry positions in any given race, while those of the leading team are restricted.
1�The leading team will, however, be granted the privilege of selecting higher-quality saddles for their race chocobos.
1�Each race title will include a code, such as C4. This code is the ??race grade.??
1�For example, a ??C4 Chocobo Race?? would indicate a typical grade 4 race.
1�We have four race grades, ranging from C4 to C1. The lower the number, the higher the grade. This, of course, means larger entry fees, but also more prize money.

1�No matter which race you enter, upon completion you will be prevented from joining any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time). Higher-grade races carry larger purses, so most racers like to use their opportunities to go after those.
1�Solo Victory Points will be awarded to you every race, depending on how well you finish.
1�As your Solo Victory Points accumulate, your chocobo will be able to gain entry to high-grade races.
1�Should a racer return to the circuit after an absence of four weeks or more, the CRA will be forced to deduct a number of Solo Victory Points.

1�Only on the rarest of occasions will such penalties be imposed. However, there are some races in which you will be unable to participate if you do not have a certain amount of Solo Victory Points in your possession.
1�Also, obtaining Solo Victory Points will also grant your nation Team Victory Points.
1�The three teams are in constant competition with one another, and a weekly ranking system is in place based on Team Victory Point totals.
1�As a team climbs up in rank, certain benefits will follow. You may see new items available for purchase with chocobucks, preferential treatment at the races, and so on.
1�Keep in mind that should you change your team affiliation, you will be forced to forfeit any accumulated Solo Victory Points.
1�We have a total of four races that run in succession.
1�Each race has its own dedicated signup window. Here there will be four attendants ready to serve all your racing needs.
1�Even if the race registration at one window closes, registration for the next race will begin immediately at the neighboring window.
1�Races will be held one after the other, so you'll have plenty of chances to watch and bet. Sit back, relax, and enjoy!
1�What would you like to hear more about?Race preparations.Signup procedure.Collecting winnings.Signing up for another race.I'm fine, thanks.
1�There are a few facts that you should know before running in a race.
1�First of all, you absolutely must be affiliated with one of the three official racing teams. These, as you may already know, are San d'Oria, Bastok, and Windurst.
1�Secondly, it is required that your bird be registered as a ??race chocobo,?? for obvious reasons. No race chocobo, no race.
1�Thirdly, you will be responsible for providing your own items to be used during the race. The CRA leaves this to the racer's discretion...
1�All of these services can be provided at any racing center, but to facilitate the registration process it is recommended that you conduct all such affairs at the appropriate branch.
1�A racing fee is necessary to gain entry into a chocobo race. The racing center will inform you of the cost, so please be sure to pay when signing up for a race.
1�Also, when signing up to race, you will be able to choose a saddle, as well as the lane in which your chocobo will race.

1�There are multifarious saddles at the rider's disposal, each of which will affect your chocobo's conditioning. In addition, the types of saddles available will change depending on your team's current ranking.
1�There are a total of eight lanes, but general conditions for all of them are the same. Feel free to race in the lane of your choice.
1�Setting these options will complete the signup process. You will then be given  $????, which you will need to exchange later to collect any winnings.

1�In the event that you should lose or misplace your #????, you will be unable to collect any prize money, chocobucks, or Victory Points that you may be entitled to. I cannot stress enough how important it is to hold on to it.
1�The races can be viewed from our grandstand area. Take a seat and cheer on your bird!
1�You will be eligible for prize money if your chocobo places either first, second, or third.
1�To collect, simply hand in the #???? you received during race signup at any signup center.
1�The amount of gil, chocobucks, and Victory Points you qualify to receive will be based upon your bird's placement.
1�You will lose the right to collect your winnings from a race exactly one week after that race has ended.
1�After participating in a race, your chocobo will be unable to join any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time).
1�This pertains only to races held here, and will not affect your eligibility for races held at any other racetracks.
1�We have implemented these restrictions here as to allow the greatest number of participants' entry into our races. Your patience and understanding are appreciated.
1�What would you like to ask?What is chocobetting?How do I bet?What are odds?When do I bet?How do I collect winnings?Nothing.
1�Chocobetting is a form of entertainment where bettors attempt to pick the two birds that will finish first and second in a race.
1�To make it a bit more interesting, the bettor can then wager on their picks in increments of 100 gil.
1�Should lady luck smile upon you and your picks hit, you can win prize money, the amount of which is determined by the odds for that race.
1�For example, let's say that you were to bet ten quills (1000 gil) on Entries No. 5 and No. 7.

1�And let's say that the toteboard showed the odds for the race at 110 gil. If your picks were to finish as the top two birds, you would be eligible to collect 1100 gil in winnings, for a total profit of 100 gil.
1�Of course, it goes without saying that should your picks not have the fortune of finishing in the top two places, you will receive absolutely no gil.
1�The gambler's fallacy is our mantra here at the racetrack! Remember, you are special! Let it ride!
1�To place a chocobet, you must obtain  $???? from the chocobet center.
1�For any single #????, a bettor may purchase up to 999 quills. Each quill costs 100 gil.
1�We highly recommend that you obtain information on the chocobos you will be betting on before purchasing your ticket. It is always good to know where your money is going.
1�Odds determine how much gil you will receive in winnings per quill on your chocobet ticket.

1�Winnings are calculated by taking the total monetary sum of all bets for any given pairing. For example, should ten bettors each place the same 100-quill (10,000 gil) chocobet, the total used to determine the winnings would be 100,000 gil.
1�It goes without saying that not all bettors will be winners. The money from losing bets is used to pay off the winners.
1�What this means is that if you place a bet on an unseemly chocobo pairing, or pick two birds without much money riding on them, and are fortunate enough to win, you can make quite a tidy sum.

1�Toteboards display the odds at both the chocobet center as well as the grandstand. Toteboards have eight columns with the number on top of each column representing one chocobo, and the number to the left of each column representing another. If your bet is for chocobos No. 2 and No. 5, check the #2 column to see how much a 2-5 bet will pay per quill.

1�The teams in second and third place will have the advantage of being allowed more entry positions in any given race, while those of the leading team are restricted.
1�The leading team will, however, be granted the privilege of selecting higher-quality saddles for their race chocobos.
1�Each race title will include a code, such as C4. This code is the ??race grade.??
1�For example, a ??C4 Chocobo Race?? would indicate a typical grade 4 race.
1�We have four race grades, ranging from C4 to C1. The lower the number, the higher the grade. This, of course, means larger entry fees, but also more prize money.

1�No matter which race you enter, upon completion you will be prevented from joining any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time). Higher-grade races carry larger purses, so most racers like to use their opportunities to go after those.
1�Solo Victory Points will be awarded to you every race, depending on how well you finish.
1�As your Solo Victory Points accumulate, your chocobo will be able to gain entry to high-grade races.
1�Should a racer return to the circuit after an absence of four weeks or more, the CRA will be forced to deduct a number of Solo Victory Points.

1�Only on the rarest of occasions will such penalties be imposed. However, there are some races in which you will be unable to participate if you do not have a certain amount of Solo Victory Points in your possession.
1�Also, obtaining Solo Victory Points will also grant your nation Team Victory Points.
1�The three teams are in constant competition with one another, and a weekly ranking system is in place based on Team Victory Point totals.
1�As a team climbs up in rank, certain benefits will follow. You may see new items available for purchase with chocobucks, preferential treatment at the races, and so on.
1�Keep in mind that should you change your team affiliation, you will be forced to forfeit any accumulated Solo Victory Points.
1�We have a total of four races that run in succession.
1�Each race has its own dedicated signup window. Here there will be four attendants ready to serve all your racing needs.
1�Even if the race registration at one window closes, registration for the next race will begin immediately at the neighboring window.
1�Races will be held one after the other, so you'll have plenty of chances to watch and bet. Sit back, relax, and enjoy!
1�What would you like to hear more about?Race preparations.Signup procedure.Collecting winnings.Signing up for another race.I'm fine, thanks.
1�There are a few facts that you should know before running in a race.
1�First of all, you absolutely must be affiliated with one of the three official racing teams. These, as you may already know, are San d'Oria, Bastok, and Windurst.
1�Secondly, it is required that your bird be registered as a ??race chocobo,?? for obvious reasons. No race chocobo, no race.
1�Thirdly, you will be responsible for providing your own items to be used during the race. The CRA leaves this to the racer's discretion...
1�All of these services can be provided at any racing center, but to facilitate the registration process it is recommended that you conduct all such affairs at the appropriate branch.
1�A racing fee is necessary to gain entry into a chocobo race. The racing center will inform you of the cost, so please be sure to pay when signing up for a race.
1�Also, when signing up to race, you will be able to choose a saddle, as well as the lane in which your chocobo will race.

1�There are multifarious saddles at the rider's disposal, each of which will affect your chocobo's conditioning. In addition, the types of saddles available will change depending on your team's current ranking.
1�There are a total of eight lanes, but general conditions for all of them are the same. Feel free to race in the lane of your choice.
1�Setting these options will complete the signup process. You will then be given  $????, which you will need to exchange later to collect any winnings.

1�In the event that you should lose or misplace your #????, you will be unable to collect any prize money, chocobucks, or Victory Points that you may be entitled to. I cannot stress enough how important it is to hold on to it.
1�The races can be viewed from our grandstand area. Take a seat and cheer on your bird!
1�You will be eligible for prize money if your chocobo places either first, second, or third.
1�To collect, simply hand in the #???? you received during race signup at any signup center.
1�The amount of gil, chocobucks, and Victory Points you qualify to receive will be based upon your bird's placement.
1�You will lose the right to collect your winnings from a race exactly one week after that race has ended.
1�After participating in a race, your chocobo will be unable to join any other races for a period of 20 hours (Earth time).
1�This pertains only to races held here, and will not affect your eligibility for races held at any other racetracks.
1�We have implemented these restrictions here as to allow the greatest number of participants' entry into our races. Your patience and understanding are appreciated.
1�What would you like to ask?What is chocobetting?How do I bet?What are odds?When do I bet?How do I collect winnings?Nothing.
1�Chocobetting is a form of entertainment where bettors attempt to pick the two birds that will finish first and second in a race.
1�To make it a bit more interesting, the bettor can then wager on their picks in increments of 100 gil.
1�Should lady luck smile upon you and your picks hit, you can win prize money, the amount of which is determined by the odds for that race.
1�For example, let's say that you were to bet ten quills (1000 gil) on Entries No. 5 and No. 7.

1�And let's say that the toteboard showed the odds for the race at 110 gil. If your picks were to finish as the top two birds, you would be eligible to collect 1100 gil in winnings, for a total profit of 100 gil.
1�Of course, it goes without saying that should your picks not have the fortune of finishing in the top two places, you will receive absolutely no gil.
1�The gambler's fallacy is our mantra here at the racetrack! Remember, you are special! Let it ride!
1�To place a chocobet, you must obtain  $???? from the chocobet center.
1�For any single #????, a bettor may purchase up to 999 quills. Each quill costs 100 gil.
1�We highly recommend that you obtain information on the chocobos you will be betting on before purchasing your ticket. It is always good to know where your money is going.
1�Odds determine how much gil you will receive in winnings per quill on your chocobet ticket.

1�Winnings are calculated by taking the total monetary sum of all bets for any given pairing. For example, should ten bettors each place the same 100-quill (10,000 gil) chocobet, the total used to determine the winnings would be 100,000 gil.
1�It goes without saying that not all bettors will be winners. The money from losing bets is used to pay off the winners.
1�What this means is that if you place a bet on an unseemly chocobo pairing, or pick two birds without much money riding on them, and are fortunate enough to win, you can make quite a tidy sum.

1�Toteboards display the odds at both the chocobet center as well as the grandstand. Toteboards have eight columns with the number on top of each column representing one chocobo, and the number to the left of each column representing another. If your bet is for chocobos No. 2 and No. 5, check the #2 column to see how much a 2-5 bet will pay per quill.

1�If you should happen to get lost on the circuit grounds, please consult one of the attendants with red berets. They will be able to help you get around.

1�When purchasing a chocobet ticket, you will be asked to place a quinella bet. This means that you will choose the two chocobos that you think will place first and second. If you are lucky enough to win, you may then exchange the ticket and collect your winnings.

1�What topic would you like clarification on?Chocobet tickets.Winnings.Quit.Return.

1�When purchasing a chocobet ticket, you will be asked to place a quinella bet. This means that you will choose the two chocobos that you think will place first and second. If you are lucky enough to win, you may then exchange the ticket and collect your winnings.
1�In our current chocobet system, as long as your two picks finish in the top two, the order doesn't matter.
1�The size of a chocobet ticket is measured in quills. One quill costs 100 gil, and a single ticket can contain up to 999 quills. Try it once, and you'll get hooked for sure!
1�You can stand to make quite a profit if you buy a chocobet ticket and it hits!
1�The fewer the bettors who have selected the same chocobos as you, the greater your winnings will be! In the industry, we call those the ??odds.??
1�You can always check the current odds when you place a chocobet. However, the odds are always apt to change right up until the chocobet window closes for that race. So be careful!
1�To collect your winnings, simply bring your chocobet ticket back to any of us here at the betting center.
1�However, you should know that a winning chocobet ticket is only valid for one week following completion of the race. After that, it will expire, so be sure to cash it in before then!
